apartment-lease-agreement.metaTitle: Create Apartment Lease Agreement Online | UDocument
apartment-lease-agreement.metaDescription: Generate a legally sound residential lease agreement in 7 minutes. Our template protects the rights of both landlord and tenant in accordance with Ukrainian law.
apartment-lease-agreement.h1: Create an apartment lease agreement online in 7 minutes
apartment-lease-agreement.description: Form a legally competent residential lease agreement that reliably protects the rights of both the landlord and the tenant in Ukraine. Our template considers all essential terms provided by the Civil Code: lease term, rent amount and payment procedure, rights and obligations of the parties, liability for property damage, conditions for early termination, and the apartment handover certificate.
whenNeededList: When renting out an apartment, house, or room for a long term.
To formally record agreements and avoid disputes.
To protect against dishonest tenants or landlords.
As a basis for obtaining temporary registration of residence.

faqItems.question: Is it necessary to notarize the agreement?
faqItems.answer: No, for a residential lease agreement concluded for up to 3 years, notarization is not mandatory. However, it can be done at the parties' request.

faqItems.question: What if I want to make changes to the template?
faqItems.answer: After generation, you can download the document in Word format (.docx) and freely edit it, adding or changing clauses according to your agreements.

power-of-attorney-vehicle.metaTitle: General Power of Attorney for a Vehicle Online | UDocument
power-of-attorney-vehicle.metaDescription: Create a power of attorney for a car for selling, driving, or representing in service centers. Fast, reliable, and compliant with legislation.
power-of-attorney-vehicle.h1: Issue a power of attorney for a vehicle in 5 minutes
power-of-attorney-vehicle.description: Form a legally correct power of attorney to grant authority to another person regarding your vehicle. The document allows representing interests in the service centers of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, selling the car, undergoing technical inspection, and performing other actions clearly defined in the text.
whenNeededList: When selling a car without the owner's presence.
To grant the right to drive a vehicle to a family member or another person.
For representing interests in insurance companies or service centers.
For driving the car abroad.

faqItems.question: Is it mandatory to notarize a power of attorney for a car?
faqItems.answer: Yes, a power of attorney related to the disposal of a vehicle (sale, gift) is subject to mandatory notarization for its validity.

faqItems.question: What is the maximum term for such a power of attorney?
faqItems.answer: The term of the power of attorney is set by the principal and can be any duration. If the term is not specified, the power of attorney remains valid until it is revoked by the principal.

power-of-attorney-vehicle.ctaButtonText: Create Power of Attorney for Vehicle

llc-registration.metaTitle: LLC Registration Online - Document Package | UDocument
llc-registration.metaDescription: Prepare a complete package of documents for registering a Limited Liability Company (LLC) in Ukraine. Charter, minutes, application - all ready for submission.
llc-registration.h1: Prepare documents for LLC registration in 15 minutes
llc-registration.description: Forget about complex legal templates. Our service will help you quickly and without errors form the entire necessary package of documents for the state registration of an LLC: the charter (including a model one), the minutes of the founders' general meeting, and the registration application. Everything complies with current legal requirements.
whenNeededList: When you decide to start your own business in the form of an LLC.
For quick preparation of documents without involving a lawyer.
To avoid errors in the charter or minutes that could lead to a registration denial.
If you are creating a company with several partners.

faqItems.question: Can I use a model charter?
faqItems.answer: Yes, our builder allows you to choose between developing an individual charter and using a model charter approved by the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine.

faqItems.question: How do I submit the generated documents?
faqItems.answer: You can submit the documents to the state registrar (at an Administrative Services Center) in person or online through the 'Diia' portal by signing them with an electronic digital signature (QES).

debt-collection-lawsuit.metaTitle: Debt Collection Lawsuit Claim - Template | UDocument
debt-collection-lawsuit.metaDescription: Form a legally sound statement of claim for debt collection under a loan agreement or promissory note. A ready-to-file court document.
debt-collection-lawsuit.h1: Create a debt collection lawsuit online
debt-collection-lawsuit.description: If a debtor fails to repay funds, going to court is an effective way to protect your rights. Our builder will help you draft a statement of claim that meets all the requirements of the Civil Procedure Code of Ukraine. The document will include the justification for the claims, calculation of the debt amount, and necessary attachments.
whenNeededList: If a person fails to repay a debt under a promissory note or loan agreement.
To officially initiate the legal process of debt collection.
To avoid errors that could cause the court to leave the claim without action.
When pre-trial dispute resolution methods have failed.

faqItems.question: Do I need to pay a court fee?
faqItems.answer: Yes, filing a property-related claim involves paying a court fee, the amount of which depends on the claim amount. A receipt of payment is attached to the claim.

faqItems.question: What should I do after filing the lawsuit?
faqItems.answer: After filing the claim, the court opens proceedings and schedules a hearing date, notifying the parties. You will need to attend the hearings to support your claims.

petition-for-divorce.metaDescription: Prepare a divorce petition for filing with the court. A simple and civilized way to resolve family matters.
petition-for-divorce.description: Divorce through the court is necessary if the spouses have minor children or if one spouse does not consent to the divorce. Our service will help you draft a legally competent petition that contains all the necessary information for the court and complies with the requirements of the Family Code of Ukraine.
whenNeededList: If the spouses have common minor children.
When one of the spouses objects to the divorce.
To officially terminate the marital relationship through the court.
If you wish to resolve the matter in a civilized and lawful manner.

faqItems.question: Can property division issues be resolved in this petition?
faqItems.answer: This template is specifically for divorce. Claims for property division or alimony can be filed as a separate lawsuit or included in this one, which will complicate and prolong the process. It is recommended to resolve these issues separately.

faqItems.question: To which court should the petition be filed?
faqItems.answer: A divorce petition is filed with the court at the place of residence of the respondent (the other spouse). Exceptions are possible if minor children live with the petitioner.

power-of-attorney-property.metaTitle: Power of Attorney for Real Estate Transactions | UDocument
power-of-attorney-property.metaDescription: Create a power of attorney to sell, buy, or manage real estate (apartment, house, land plot). Full legal protection.
power-of-attorney-property.h1: Create a power of attorney for real estate
power-of-attorney-property.description: Grant authority to a trusted person to carry out transactions with your real estate. This document allows them to sell, buy, rent out, and represent your interests in government bodies and before third parties regarding a specific real estate object. The template includes all requirements for notarization.
whenNeededList: When buying or selling real estate if you cannot be present in person.
To manage your property (e.g., renting it out) when you are in another city or country.
To collect necessary documents and certificates for a transaction.
To authorize a professional (realtor, lawyer) to represent your interests.

faqItems.question: Is notarization of such a power of attorney mandatory?
faqItems.answer: Yes, a power of attorney for the disposal of real estate is subject to mandatory notarization and registration in the Unified Register of Powers of Attorney.

faqItems.question: Can a power of attorney be issued to several people?
faqItems.answer: Yes, you can specify one or more authorized persons who can act either jointly or independently of each other, depending on how it is stated in the text of the power of attorney.

power-of-attorney-documents.metaTitle: Power of Attorney for Representation and Document Collection | UDocument
power-of-attorney-documents.metaDescription: Form a power of attorney to represent your interests in authorities, courts, banks, and to receive documents on your behalf.
power-of-attorney-documents.h1: Issue a power of attorney for representation
power-of-attorney-documents.description: This power of attorney grants your representative the right to submit and receive documents, sign, and represent your interests in any institutions, enterprises, and organizations, including courts, tax authorities, Administrative Service Centers, banks, etc. You can clearly define the scope of authority.
whenNeededList: When you need a representative in court or another government body.
To receive a pension, mail, or other payments.
To authorize someone to submit documents on your behalf to any institution.
To conduct business on your behalf when you are busy or far away.

faqItems.question: Does such a power of attorney need to be notarized?
faqItems.answer: It depends on the institution where the power of attorney will be used. For representation in court, banks, and for real estate transactions, notarization is mandatory. For receiving mail, a simple written form may be sufficient.

faqItems.question: Can I revoke the power of attorney?
faqItems.answer: Yes, the principal can revoke the power of attorney at any time by notifying the representative and the third parties for whom it was issued. A notarized power of attorney is revoked through a notary.

trustSection.title: With us it's —
trustSection.description: We have combined 8 years of legal experience with our unique technology to guarantee the legal accuracy of every document.
trustSection.descriptionStrong: UDocument is a modern approach to law where your time, security, and quality are the top priority.

ourBenefitsSection.title: The result you get with UDocument:

features.lawDef: Full legal support and security for real estate transactions in Ukraine.
features.structure: A clear business structure and expert guidance in corporate law.
features.contracts: Instant generation of legally accurate documents online with expert review.
features.notaryServices: Fast processing of notarial documents, translations, and apostilles in Great Britain.

why_choose_us.title: Why Choose UDocument?
why_choose_us.subtitle: We have transformed complex legal processes into simple and reliable solutions.

advantages.title: Experience, Amplified by AI
advantages.text: Our 8+ years of legal practice are combined with AI technologies to solve your tasks faster and more efficiently.

advantages.title: Instant Online Generation
advantages.text: Create legally sound documents in minutes. Our assistant will guide you through the process step-by-step.

advantages.title: Legal Accuracy and Relevance
advantages.text: All our documents and consultations comply with the current legislation of Ukraine. This is guaranteed by our 'dual control': lawyer and technology.

advantages.title: Comprehensive Business Support
advantages.text: From company registration to ongoing legal support. We cover all your business's legal needs in one place.

advantages.title: Security in Real Estate Transactions
advantages.text: We protect your interests at every stage: from property verification to the final agreement. Your investment is securely protected.

advantages.title: Service Between Ukraine and Britain
advantages.text: We build a legal bridge between the two countries: from apostilles and document notarization in Great Britain to their use in Ukraine.

advantages.title: Transparency and Confidentiality
advantages.text: We operate with clear pricing without hidden fees. Your data and cases are kept under strict protection and are completely confidential.

faq.title: Step 1: Account Registration
faq.description: Create a personal account using your email address. This is your secure space for working with documents.

faq.title: Step 2: Email Confirmation
faq.description: We will send you a verification email. Simply click the link within it to activate and secure your account.

faq.title: Step 3: Document Selection
faq.description: In your personal account, you will find a catalog of available legal documents. Choose the one that meets your needs.

faq.title: Step 4: Data Entry
faq.description: Our online assistant will ask you a few simple questions. Prepare the necessary data (e.g., passport and tax ID number) to make the process even faster.

faq.title: Step 5: Generation and Download
faq.description: Click the 'Generate' button. Your document will be created instantly and available for download in PDF format, fully ready for printing and use.

privacy_policy.meta_description: Official Privacy Policy of UDocument. Learn how we collect, use, and protect your personal data in accordance with Ukrainian law.
privacy_policy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy_policy.introduction_text: Welcome to UDocument! This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our website and services. We are committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the security of your personal data in accordance with the Law of Ukraine 'On Personal Data Protection' and generally accepted international standards.
privacy_policy.data_collection_text: We may collect the following categories of personal data:
data_collection_list: Personal Identification Information: name, surname, patronymic, email address, phone number, passport details, identification number (RNOKPP), which you provide during registration or document generation.
Data for Documents: any information you enter into forms to create legal documents (e.g., real estate details, information about the parties to an agreement, etc.).
Technical Information: IP address, browser type, operating system, visit data (including URLs), and cookies to improve the service.
privacy_policy.data_usage_text: Your data is used exclusively for the following purposes:
data_usage_list: Providing and Improving Services: to create and manage your account, generate legal documents, provide consultations, and offer technical support.
Communication: to send service notifications, registration confirmations, respond to your inquiries, and inform you about updates to our services.
Security: to protect our platform from fraud and abuse.
Analytics: to analyze service usage for its improvement and optimization (data is used in an anonymous, aggregated form).
privacy_policy.data_commitment_text: We guarantee that your personal data will NOT be sold, rented, or used for any commercial purposes not related to the provision of UDocument services.
privacy_policy.data_protection_text: We implement modern technical and organizational security measures to protect your data from unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. Data is stored on secure servers. We retain your data only as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, or as required by law.
privacy_policy.user_rights_text: In accordance with the legislation of Ukraine, you have the right to:
user_rights_list: Know the sources of collection, the location of your personal data, and the purpose of its processing.
Request the correction of inaccurate data or the deletion of your data.
Withdraw consent for the processing of personal data.
Lodge complaints regarding the processing of your data with the Ukrainian Parliament Commissioner for Human Rights or in court.
privacy_policy.cookies_text: We use cookies to ensure the functionality of the site and improve your experience. These are small text files stored on your device. You can manage cookie settings in your browser.
privacy_policy.changes_text: We may update this Policy from time to time. All changes will become effective upon their publication on this page. We recommend that you review it regularly to stay informed of the current version.
privacy_policy.contact_us_text: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us by email:

signup.meta_title: Sign Up for a New Account
